alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 2:32PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE EAST TROUBLESOME BURN AREA IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Parts of the southwestern East Troublesome burn area. A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Around 0.20-0.30 inches has fallen. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Grand County - This includes the following additional locations... Lower Stillwater Creek, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch, Elk Mountain and Upper Corral Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
